author: julianfoad
msg: ^/branches/fs-successor-ids: Delete, so I can recreate an up-to-date
version of it.

author: stsp
msg: * STATUS: Nominate r40451 and r40452

author: stsp
msg: On the 1.6.x-r40452 branch, fix 'svn resolve --accept=theirs-conflict'
for targets which live in a subdirectory of the current working directory.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c
(resolve_conflict_on_entry): Only conflict paths retrieved from the
entry must be joined with the path of their containing directory.
Paths to temporary files as used in the 'theirs-conflict' case are
already relative to the current working directory, and can be passed
to svn_io_copy_file() unchanged.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/resolved_tests.py
(test_lits): Remove XFAIL from theirs_conflict_in_subdir.

author: stsp
msg: On the 1.6.x-r40452 branch, merge r40451 and r40452 from trunk.
NB: Changes made to libsvn_wc/conflicts.c on trunk ended up in
libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c in 1.6.x. To avoid creating subtree mergeinfo,
a patch was applied and a --record-only merge from trunk was done,
rather than merging from trunk's libsvn_wc/conflicts.c to this
branch's libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c.
Also note that the theirs_conflict_in_subdir() test is still marked
XFail, because 1.6.x has yet another bug which causes the test to fail:
svn: warning: Can't open file 'svn-test-work/working_copies/resolved_tests-3.wc2/A/B/E/svn-test-work/working_copies/resolved_tests-3.wc2/A/B/E/.svn/tmp/tempfile.tmp': No such file or directory
This failure will be fixed shortly.

author: hwright
msg: Cleanup the working copy upgrade code by using a fall-through switch statement,
rather than a bunch of if statements (which always get executed in order,
anyway).
* subversion/libsvn_wc/upgrade.c
(svn_wc__upgrade_sdb): Switch to a switch.
